class NativeImageDecoder

Detailed Description

The class NativeImage is a wrapper-class for APOXI-bitmaps. A native image can hold a reference to an instance of the class Bitmap, BitmapRes or a BitmapRes-animation. APOXI-bitmaps usually need more memory than e. g. a GIF image or JPEG image, but may be drawn very fast. It is also possible to read APOXI-bitmaps out of a binary data stream, which may be generated with the APOXI Resource Compiler.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

NativeImage::NativeImage (   ) 
 

If the default constructor is used, the parameters have to be provided by using the method Init.

NativeImage::NativeImage (  Bitmap *  bitmap  ) 
 

Parameters:
bitmap Pointer to a bitmap.

NativeImage::NativeImage (  const BitmapRes *  bitmap_res  ) 
 

Parameters:
BitmapRes Pointer to an bitmap resource.

NativeImage::NativeImage (  BinData *  bin_data  ) 
 

Parameters:
bin_data Pointer to a binary data stream which contains the native image data. After passing the binary data stream, the stream is obtained by the native image and hence automatically released in the destructor of the native image. A native-image-data-stream can be generated with the APOXI Resource Compiler.

NativeImage::NativeImage (  const BitmapRes *const *  animation_res,
UINT  frame_count,
UINT32  frame_delay = 0
) 
 

Initializes the native image with an animation represented by an array of bitmap resources.

Parameters:
animation_res Pointer to an array of bitmap-pointers.
frame_count Number of bitmaps specified by the bitmap-array.
frame_delay The delay given in milliseconds between 2 frames. If frame_delay is 0, the default-value will be used.
